feds.admin_not_in_fed: User {user} is not a {name} Federation admin
feds.no_fbanned_in_fed: Noone user was banned in {fed_name} Federation!
feds.fban_creator: How I can ban Federation creator?! I don't think it's funny.
feds.fban_fed_admin: I'm not banning a fed admin from their own fed!

notes.title: Notes are great to save random tidbits of information; a phone number, a nice gif, a funny picture - anything!

text.i2: - /save (name) (data): Replying to a message will save that message. Even works on media!
text.i3: - /get (name): get the note registered to that word.
text.i7: - /noteinfo (name): Shows detailed info about note, who updated and created note
text.i8: An example of how to save a note would be via:
text.i11: Now, anyone using /get data, or #data will be replied to with This is example note!.
text.i12: If you want to save an image, gif, or sticker, or any other data, do the following:
text.i13: `save word` while replying to a sticker or whatever data you'd like. Now, the note at `#word` contains a sticker which will be sent as a reply.
text.i14: Tip: to retrieve a note without the formatting, use `/get (name) noformat`
text.i15: This will retrieve the note and send it without formatting it; getting you the raw markdown, allowing you to make easy edits.

vars.a1: You can use special variable in notes, here is a list of it:
vars.a6: {mention} - Gives the link to user, ex. Sophie
vars.a7: {id} - Gives the id of the user, ex. '885745757'
vars.a8: {chatname} - Gives the current chat name, ex. 'Sophie chat'

md.a1: You can use markdown to make your messages more expressive. This is the markdown currently supported:
md.a2: `code words`: backticks allow you to wrap your words in monospace fonts. Shows as: code words
md.a3: **bold words**: asterixes are used for bold font. Shows as: bold words
md.a4: __italic words__: underscores are used for italics. Shows as: italic words
md.a5: [hyperlink](example.com): this is used for hyperlinks, and will show as such: hyperlink. Make sure not to add any extra spaces between the ] and the ( or it won't be valid markdown.

html.a1: Markdown is easy, but when you will be making many notes, note by note, you will see obvious flaws, every extra '*' can broke your perfect note.
html.a2: How about HTML? Let's try use it instead of markdown. Please read before the 'Markdown' guide.
html.a3: To use the HTML in the note add the `[format:html]` to the end of note, you can fully disable formatting note by `[format:none]`.
html.a8: `hyperlink`: Example of hyperlink, will shown as [hyperlink](example.com)

btns.a1: Making buttons isn't so hard as you expected. Unlike other bots Sophie have many types of custom buttons, let's try to use it!
btns.a2: Lets start by default url buttons, url buttons have such syntax [Button name](buttonurl:https://url.com).
btns.a3: Ok, you added many buttons to your message, but it looks ugly? You wanna make few buttons per line? This will help you:
btns.a4: Add :same at the end of your link; it'll set it on the same line as the other one. For example:
btns.a6: You can set more than 2 buttons per row, do not overdo it.
btns.a7: Ok, you just created you note with many buttons, you will see that you do not have enough just url buttons, see other's:
btns.a8: - [Button name](buttonnote:name_of_note): With such types of button you will get a note in your PM, this done to prevent spamming notes in pm.
btns.a9: - [Button name](buttonalert:name_of_note): This one will show you popup with note data (Warning, only text supported by popups), for example this can be done for rules, you are limited only by your imagination and by 200 symbols limit for popups
btns.a10: - [Button name](deletemsg:admin): Some notes used by warning, or notify, after reading it it leaving in chat, it spammy, right? This button will remove message, it have argument to control which one can be remove message `user` or `admin`.
btns.a11: Create your beautiful and functional notes with Sophie.

enc.a0: Sophie respects your privacy, you are allowed to encrypt your notes to save your data privacy.
enc.a1: By default all notes are encrypted with particle method.
enc.a2: Just add a `[encryption:fully]` in note text to encrypt it fully with password requesting.
enc.a4: /save test_note This is a text of test_note [encryption:fully]
enc.a5: You can also disable encryption fully by [encryption:no]

purges.title: Need to delete a lot of messages? That's what purges are for!

text.i2: - /purge: deletes all messages from the message you replied to, to the current message.
text.i3: - /del: deletes the message you replied to.

warns.title: Keep your members in check with warnings; stop them getting out of control!

text.i2: - /warn (reason): warns a user for the specified reason.
text.i3: - /warns: returns the list of warns, with reasons, for that user.
text.i5: - /resetwarns: resets all of a user's warns.
text.i6: - /warnlimit (number): sets the number of warns before an action is taken upon the user.
text.i7: If you're looking for a way to automatically warn users when they say certain things, go to the blacklists module.
text.i8: An example of how to set a new multiword warning:
text.i10: This will warn the user called @user, with a reason of 'Because warning is fun'.

misc.title: An "odds and ends" module for small, simple commands which don't really fit anywhere

text.i2: - /id: gives an ID of user and chat.
text.i5: - /runs: responds with a randomly generated 'run away' string.

connections.title: Sometimes, you just want to add some notes and filters to a group chat, but you don't want everyone to see; This is where connections come in...

text.i0: This allows you to connect to a chat's database, and add things to it without the chat knowing about it! For obvious reasons, you need to be an admin to add things; but any member can view your data. (banned/kicked users can't!)
text.i2: - /connect (chat): connects to the chat with chat username/ID, allowing you to view/edit contents.
text.i3: - /connect: shows last 3 chats to fast connect.
text.i4: You can retrieve the chat ID by using the /id command in your chat. Don't be surprised if the id is negative; all super groups have negative ids.

greetings.title: Give your members a warm welcome with the greetings module!

text.i0: Welcomes are a note trigger, use /setwelcome to set welcome trigger to note.
text.i3: Note: Please keep in mind, Sophie uses notes for welcome, you must create note with welcome text and set note as welcome.
text.i8: - /cleanservice: Remove Telegram service messages about user joined or leaved chat.
text.i9: - /cleanwelcome: Deletes old welcome messages; when a new person joins, the old message is deleted.
text.i10: - /welcomesecurity [off/soft/hard]: soft - restricts user's permission to send media files for 24 hours, hard - restict user's permission to send messages until they click on the button 'I'm not a bot'.

filters.title: Make your chat more lively with filters

text.i2: - /addfilter: Add a new filter in your chat.
text.i4: - /filters: Will display all filters in that chat!
text.i5: - /delfilter (keyword/key words) : Will stop the given filter names

federations.title: Group management.. It's fun, until you start getting spammers in all your chats, and you need to ban them. Then you need to start banning more, and more, and it gets painful. How can you deal? Do you have to ban them manually, in all your groups?

text.i0: No more! With federations, you can make a ban in one chat overlap to all your other chats. You can even appoint federation admins, so that your trustworthiest admins can ban across all the chats that you want to protect.
text.i2: - /newfed (fedname): Creates a new federation with the given name. Users are allowed to own one federation only. Using this method when you already have a fed will simply change the federation name.
text.i3: - /joinfed (FedID): Joins the current chat to the federation. Each chat can only be in one federation. Only chat owners can do this.
text.i4: - /finfo: Shows info about current chat Federation, you can /finfo (Fed ID) - to see info about other Federation.
text.i5: Federation admins, they can use a fban command and others, to control they use this commands:
text.i6: - /fpromote (user): Promotes the user to fed admin in your fed.
text.i7: - /fdemote (user): Demotes the user from fed admin to normal user, in your fed.
text.i9: - /fban (user): Bans a user from the current chat's federation.
text.i10: - /unfban (user): Unbans a user the current chat's federation.
text.i11: /fchats: Shows a list of all chats which connected to your Federation.

disabling.title: You might not like all the Sophie's features and wanna disable something to reduce spam in your group? If yes!, then this module is for you!

text.a4: - /disablable: See command list which commands can be disabled.
text.a5: - /disabled: List of disabled commands in current chat.

pin.title: You wanna pin the message? Here you go.

text.a2: - /pin: pins the message you replied to; add 'loud' to send a notification to group members.

lang.title: Not everyone can speak with perfect English, Sophie have a translation system, check it out.

text.a2: /lang: Will show a buttons with all languages and it will show current chat language.
text.a3: /lang (lang): Will change the language without selecting it with buttons.
text.a4: Not all the languages are currently supported, help us with translation on our crowdin page

rules.title: Save your chat with your rules

text.a3: Note: Please keep in mind, Sophie uses notes for rules, you must create note with rules text and set it
text.a7: Rules button will appear in the warn message

text.a1: Sophie team constantly improve privacy and security.
text.a3: - We use a server provided by vultr in Amsterdam.
text.a4: - None of the SUDO have access to it.
text.a5: - Server is totally secured by ssh keys and have enabled ufw.

collection.a2: * We don't collect your privacy data
collection.a3: * We don't save your messages or any info about your messages
collection.a4: * We collect only data which saved in Sophie (ex. notes)
collection.a5: * We are collecting users public data only:
collection.a6: - We collect first and last names, used id and a used_id
collection.a7: - We need this data for fast finding the user by nickname (ex. if you typing /warn @someone)
collection.a8: - We never use this data to make user profiles, it's just a some info to make Sophie faster and independent from Telegram's requests
collection.a10: - We save the chat name and chat id, we don't save chat admins and creators
collection.a11: - We don't use chats data in analytics
collection.a12: - We need this data to make Sophie support operations in multiple chats, for example broadcasts, connections, etc.
collection.a14: - We use ONLY Sophie general metrics as speed, count of data types in all chats
collection.a15: - We auto-log errors which generated by Sophie (They have very limited info, only a error string and date)
collection.a16: - We log a gbans which done by SUDO's (with gbanned user_id)
collection.a18: Sophie saving event message in case if crash happend, that info can be used only for improving Sophie, nobody can't see it except a bot owner.
collection.a19: If you don't wont give your events on crashes pm @MrYacha for blacklisting your ID or whole your chat.

removing.a1: Right now there is no way to do it automatically, but it is in Sophie team To-Do list.
removing.a2: However you can ask @MrYacha to do it manually.

reports.title: Report an annoying user to admins.

text.a4: - /report (@user) (reason): Report a user to admins. Users only. Ex: /report @baduser bad user.
text.a5: - @admin reason: Same as upper command but doesn't support custom tags to report.
